text: Silence is so freaking loud
author: Sarah Dessen

text: In the summer
author: Nizar Qabbani

text: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
author: Albert Camus

text: You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Do no harm and leave the world a better place than you found it.
author: Patricia Cornwell

text: You always have a choice. It's just that some people make the wrong one.

text: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.

text: For me, literacy means freedom. For the individual and for society.

text: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it.

text: Accio Brain!

text: You know it's never fifty-fifty in a marriage. It's always seventy-thirty, or sixty-forty. Someone falls in love first. Someone puts someone else up on a pedestal. Someone works very hard to keep things rolling smoothly; someone else sails along for the ride.

text: The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.

text: All my days I have longed equally to travel the right road and to take my own errant path.

text: The bird, the pin, the song, the berries, the watch, the cracker, the dress that burst into flames. I am the mockingjay. The one that survived despite the Capitol's plans. The symbol of the rebellion.

text: What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.

text: The truth is what I make it. I could set this world on fire and call it rain.

text: There's nothing worse than waiting and not knowing what'll happen to you. Your own imagination can be crueler than any captor.

text: To hurt is as human as to breathe.

text: The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.

text: It's the mortal cup Jace, not the mortal toilet bowl.

text: You think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?

text: It's so strange how life works: You want something and you wait and wait and feel like it's taking forever to come. Then it happens and it's over and all you want to do is curl back up in that moment before things changed.

text: The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.

text: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.

text: if you love two people at the same time, choose the second. Because if you really loved the first one, you wouldn't have fallen for the second.

text: Lord, what fools these mortals be!

text: Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.

text: Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.

text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

text: Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.

text: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.

text: If you want to be happy, be.

text: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.

text: The problem with doing nothing is not knowing when you are finished.

text: Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.

text: See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.

text: I don't think there is any truth. There are only points of view.

text: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.

text: Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you.

text: Dress shabbily and they remember the dress; dress impeccably and they remember the woman.

text: It is often in the darkest
author: Richard Evans

author: Albert Einstein

text: While I sleep, I dream of you, and when I wake, I long to hold you in my arms. If anything, our time apart has only made me more certain that I want to spend my nights by your side, and my days with your heart.

text: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.

text: I am a part of all that I have met.

text: Yes, we praise women over 40 for a multitude of reasons. Unfortunately, it's not reciprocal. For every stunning, smart, well-coiffed, hot woman over 40, there is a bald, paunchy relic in yellow pants making a fool of himself with some 22-year old waitress. Ladies, I apologize. For all those men who say, "Why buy the cow when you can get the milk for free?", here's an update for you. Nowadays 80% of women are against marriage. Why? Because women realize it's not worth buying an entire pig just to get a little sausage!

text: Every life has death and every light has shadow. Be content to stand in the light and let the shadow fall where it will.

text: All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope

text: Be awesome! Be a book nut!

text: God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a Dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who
author: Terry Pratchett

text: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.

text: أسوء تعذيب فى العالم هو الشخص المُصر على الكلام بينما أنت مُثقل بالهموم , ترغب فى أن تبقى صامتاً وأن تصغى لأفكارك.

text: Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.

text: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.

text: The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind.

text: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.

text: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?

text: There were always in me, two women at least, one woman desperate and bewildered, who felt she was drowning and another who would leap into a scene, as upon a stage, conceal her true emotions because they were weaknesses, helplessness, despair, and present to the world only a smile, an eagerness, curiosity, enthusiasm, interest.

text: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.

text: livid

text: It matters not how strait the gate
author: William Ernest Henley

text: You don't love a girl because of beauty. You love her because she sings a song only you can understand.

text: Stepping onto a brand-new path is difficult, but not more difficult than remaining in a situation, which is not nurturing to the whole woman.

text: I fell in love with you, smartass, because you were one of us—because you weren’t afraid of me, and you decided to end your spectacular victory by throwing that piece of bone at Amarantha like a javelin. I felt Cassian’s spirit beside me in that moment, and could have sworn I heard him say, ‘If you don’t marry her, you stupid prick, I will.

text: Open your eyes and see what you can with them before they close forever.

text: Everyone has secrets. It's just a matter of finding out what they are.

text: The past beats inside me like a second heart.

text: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have Faith.

text: Coach: "All right, Patch. let's say you're at a party. the room is full of girls of all shapes and sizes. You see blondes, brunettes, redheads, a few girl with black hair. Some are talkive, while other appear shy. You've one girl who fits your profile - attractive, intelligent and vulnerable. Dow do you let her know you're interested?"

text: After all, Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels.

text: No mourners. No funerals. Among them, it passed for 'good luck.

text: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?

text: Not that I want to be a god or a hero. Just to change into a tree, grow for ages, not hurt anyone.

text: One more time? For the audience?" he says. His voice isn't angry. It's hollow, which is worse. Already the boy with the bread is slipping away from me.

text: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!

text: Books: a beautifully browsable invention that needs no electricity and exists in a readable form no matter what happens.

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

text: It's like learning to ride a unicorn. You never forget.

text: There were things I wanted to tell him. But I knew they would hurt him. So I buried them, and let them hurt me.

text: Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.

text: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.

text: I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it.

text: I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.

text: في داخلي شُرْفَةٌ
author: محمود درويش

text: I walk around the school hallways and look at the people. I look at the teachers and wonder why they're here. If they like their jobs. Or us. And I wonder how smart they were when they were fifteen. Not in a mean way. In a curious way. It's like looking at all the students and wondering who's had their heart broken that day, and how they are able to cope with having three quizzes and a book report due on top of that. Or wondering who did the heart breaking. And wondering why.
author: Stephen Chbosky

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity
author: Albert Einstein

text: You can't lie to your soul.
author: Irvine Welsh

text: Like all magnificent things, it's very simple.
author: Natalie Babbitt

text: Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home.
author: Edith Sitwell

text: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
author: George Carlin

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.

text: Because this is what happens when you try to run from the past. It just doesn’t catch up, it overtakes … blotting out the future.

text: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

text: Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind.
author: Jeanette Winterson

text: My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kills.

text: Never marry at all, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired, women, because they are curious: both are disappointed.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I used to believe in forever, but forever's too good to be true
author: A.A. Milne

text: Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
author: C.G. Jung

text: If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends.
author: Charlotte Brontë

text: Here's to the kids.
author: Pete Wentz

text: Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Even if you cannot change all the people around you, you can change the people you choose to be around. Life is too short to waste your time on people who don’t respect, appreciate, and value you. Spend your life with people who make you smile, laugh, and feel loved.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: You're beautiful and sad," I said finally, not looking at him when I did. "Just like your eyes. You're like a song that I heard when I was a little kid but forgot I knew until I heard it again." For a long moment there was only the whirring sound of the tires on the road, and then Sam said softly, "Thank you.
author: Maggie Stiefvater

text: Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

text: Ally." Peeta says the words slowly, tasting it. "Friend. Lover. Victor. Enemy. Fiancee. Target. Mutt. Neighbor. Hunter. Tribute. Ally. I'll add it to the list of words I use to try to figure you out. The problem is, I can't tell what's real anymore, and what's made up.
author: Suzanne Collins

text: What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.
author: George R.R. Martin

text: It is difficult, when faced with a situation you cannot control, to admit you can do nothing.

text: The Bhagavad Gita--that ancient Indian Yogic text--says that it is better to live your own destiny imperfectly than to live an imitation of somebody else's life with perfection.

text: Where is Wood?" said Harry, suddenly realizing he wasn't there.
author: J. K. Rowling

text: Katniss, the girl who was on fire!
author: Suzanne Collins

text: I won't ever leave you, even though you're always leaving me.
author: Audrey Niffenegger

text: Listen to them, the children of the night. What music they make!
author: Bram Stoker

text: What can you do to promote world peace? Go home and love your family.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, 'Where have I gone wrong'.
author: Charlie Schultz

text: Mental pain is less dramatic than physical pain, but it is more common and also more hard to bear. The frequent attempt to conceal mental pain increases the burden: it is easier to say My tooth is aching than to say My heart is broken.

text: I just did some calculations and I've been able to determine that you're full of shit.
author: John Green

text: It is always sad when someone leaves home, unless they are simply going around the corner and will return in a few minutes with ice-cream sandwiches.

text: sometimes you don't need a goal in life, you don't need to know the big picture. you just need to know what you're going to do next!
author: Sophie Kinsella

text: In new situations, all the trickiest rules are the ones nobody bothers to explain to you. (And the ones you can't Google.)
author: Rainbow Rowell
